Title: Kano by-election: NNPP rejects Ghari/Tsanyawa result, alleges manipulation
Summary: The ruling New Nigerian Peoples Party (NNPP) has rejected the result of Saturday's supplementary election in Ghari/Tsanyawa state assembly . NNPP alleges manipulation of the result .

Title: ADC chieftain slams Cross River govt over aircraft purchase
Summary: Effiong Efa Nyong criticised the state government for purchasing two new aircraft worth billions of naira . Nyong was a former governorship candidate of the African Democratic Congress (ADC) in Cross River State .

Title: Ondo to unveil Omoluabi Ambassadors
Summary: Ondo State government is set to launch the Omoluabi Ambassadors initiative . The initiative will promote ethical values and inclusive governance .

Title: Ooni, Ovie seek stronger ties between traditional rulers, politicians
Summary: The Ooni of Ife, Oba Adeyeye Enitan Ogunwusi, and the Ovie of Idjerhe Kingdom in Delta State, King Monday Obukohwo Whiskey (PhD), Udurhie I, have called for closer collaboration between traditional rulers and political leaders to promote national unity,

Title: Tinubu hails APC victory in by-elections
Summary: President Bola Tinubu hails APC victory in by-elections conducted in 16 constituencies across 12 states . By-election results were held on Saturday across 16 constituencies in 16 states .

Title: Labour Party condemns Saturday’s by-elections, raises concerns over 2027 polls
Summary: Labour Party condemns Saturday’s by-elections, raises concerns over 2027 polls . Party condemns election as significant setback to Nigeria's democratic journey . Party expresses deep concern over the conduct of Saturday's by-election .

Title: Emir of Zuru: Nigeria lost eminent military leader,  father – Shettima
Summary: Vice President Kashim Shettima has expressed profound grief over the passing of the Emir of Zuru in Kebbi, retired Maj. Gen. Muhammadu Sami (Gomo II) Vice President expressed grief over his father's passing .

Title: FG vows to implement ILC decisions to boost workers’ welfare, national development
Summary: FG vows to implement ILC decisions to boost workers’ welfare, national development . Federal Government has outlined the country’s commitment to implementing key recommendations from the recently concluded International Labour Conference .

Title: FRSC phasing out booking sheet as e-ticketing gains efficiency
Summary: FRSC phasing out booking sheet as e-ticketing gains efficiency . The Federal Road Safety Corps (FRSC) is adopting the use of technology in ticketing .

Title: Tinubu hails winners of by-elections in 12 states, commends INEC
Summary: Tinubu hails winners of Saturday, August 16, by-elections in 16 constituencies across 12 states . He commends INEC for the success of the by-election held on August 16 .

Title: Jigawa PDP rejects Babura/Garki by-election results
Summary: The Peoples Democratic Party Jigawa State chapter has outrightly rejected the results of the Saturday-concluded Babura/Garki federal constituency by-election . The party’s position was made public in a statement dated 17th August, 2025, signed and made available to journalists in Dutse, the state capital,

Title: Bye-election: PDP rejects APC’s victory in Edo, cites BVAS sabotage
Summary: The Edo State chapter of the Peoples Democratic Party has rejected the results of the senatorial and House of Representatives by-elections held on Saturday, August 16, 2025 . The party accused INEC of deliberate sabotage, and described the election process as a severe blow to Nigeria’s democratic integrity . The Independent National Electoral Commission had

Title: MFM’s Olukoya ordains 5,000 ministers, warns against rebellion
Summary: Dr Daniel Olukoya has ordained 5,000 ministers during the 2025 Global Ministers Conference, which ended on Sunday . The three-day conference, with the theme “The Message, the Messenger, and the Power,” began on Friday and featured teachings, specialised sessions and ordinations .

Title: Edo condemns killing of endangered hippopotamus in Anegbete
Summary: The Edo State Forestry Commission has condemned the killing of a hippopotamus in Anegbete community, Etsako Central Local Government Area . Chairman of the commission described the animal as an endangered species that could have served as a source of tourism and sustainable livelihood .

Title: Shettima lauds late Emir of Zuru’s military legacy, traditional leadership
Summary: Vice President Kashim Shettima has expressed profound grief over the passing of the Emir of Zuru in Kebbi State, Major General Muhammadu Sani Sami (Gomo II) He described his death as a monumental loss to Nigeria’s traditional institution and military heritage . The traditional ruler and retired military officer died Saturday
